member.name: T:Rebex.Net.Smtp
member.summary: Provides methods for communication with SMTP servers.
member.remarks: All members of this class are thread-safe.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.Smtp.DefaultPort
member.summary: Default SMTP port (25).

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.Smtp.DefaultImplicitSslPort
member.summary: Default SMTP/Implicit SSL port (465).

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.Smtp.AlternativeExplicitSslPort
member.summary: Alternative SMTP/Explicit SSL port (587).

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.OnResponseRead(Rebex.Net.SmtpResponseReadEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: A that contains the event data.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.OnCommandSent(Rebex.Net.SmtpCommandSentEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: A that contains the event data.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.OnTransferProgress(Rebex.Net.SmtpTransferProgressEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: A that contains the event data.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Smtp class.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the object and all the socket objects.
member.remarks: Calling this method ensures that all resources are freed.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer. Called by garbage collector during object destruction.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the current operation.

remarks.p: The aborted operation will end either successfully, or with of status OperationAborted or Timeout. The object may remain in Reading, Sending or Processing state. In this case, the object is not usable any more and a call to is recommended.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Connects to the SMTP server.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string address.
member.returns: Welcome message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Connect(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects to the SMTP server.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string address.
The server port (e.g. 25).
member.returns: The welcome message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Connect(System.String,System.Int32,Rebex.Net.SslMode)
member.summary: Connects to the SMTP server with the specified security.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string IP address.
The server port (e.g. 25).
Connection security.
member.returns: The welcome message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Connect(System.String,Rebex.Net.SslMode)
member.summary: Connects to the SMTP server with the specified security. Uses port 25 for no SSL, 587 for explicit SSL and 465 for implicit SSL.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string IP address.
Connection security.
member.returns: The welcome message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Disconnect
member.summary: Informs the server that the connection is about to close and terminates the connection.
member.returns: The exit message returned by the server.
member.remarks: Represents SMTP QUIT command.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Secure(Rebex.Net.TlsParameters)
member.summary: Secures the connection with TLS/SSL using the specified parameters.
member.param: Security parameters.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Secure
member.summary: Secures the connection with TLS/SSL using default parameters.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
Message sender address (can be null or empty).
The list of recipients (can be null).
member.remarks:
If the sender address argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it is taken from the from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing.
If the sender address argument is empty string, it means null sender - same behavior as if "<>" would be specified.
If the recipients argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields.
The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending. Set the property to allow sending a mime message without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mail.MailMessage,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
Message sender address (can be null or empty string).
The list of recipients (can be null).
member.remarks:
If the sender address argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it is taken from the from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing.
If the sender address argument is empty string, it means null sender - same behavior as if "<>" would be specified.
If the recipients argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields.
The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending. Set the property to allow sending a mail message without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage)
member.summary: Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
member.remarks: Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending. Set the property to allow sending a mime message without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mail.MailMessage)
member.summary: Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
member.remarks: Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending. Set the property to allow sending a mail message without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a mail message constructed from the specified parameters.
member.param: Message sender.
Comma-separated list of message recipients.
The subject of the message.
The text body of the message.
member.remarks: Set the property to allow sending a mail without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads and sends a mail message from the specified stream in MIME format.
member.param: The input stream.
Message sender address (can be null or empty string).
The list of recipients (can be null).

remarks.p: The stream must contain data in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

If the sender address argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it is taken from the from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing.
If the sender address argument is empty string, it means null sender - same behavior as if "<>" would be specified.
If the recipients argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields.
The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.
Set the property to allow sending a mail without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads and sends a mail message from the specified stream in MIME format.
member.param: The input stream.

remarks.p: The stream must contain data in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.
Set the property to allow sending a mail without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Reads and sends a mail message from the specified local file in MIME format.
member.param: The path to the mail message file.

remarks.p: The file must be in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.
Set the property to allow sending a mail without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads and sends a mail message from the specified local file in MIME format.
member.param: The path to the mail message file.
Message sender address (can be null or empty string).
The list of recipients (can be null).

remarks.p: The stream must contain data in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

If the sender address argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it is taken from the from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing.
If the sender address argument is empty string, it means null sender - same behavior as if "<>" would be specified.
If the recipients argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields.
The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.
Set the property to allow sending a mail without a sender specified.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Login(System.String,System.String,Rebex.Net.SmtpAuthentication)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the SMTP server using the specified authentication method.
member.param: User name.
Password.
Authentication method.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Login(System.String,Rebex.Net.SmtpAuthentication)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the SMTP server using an OAuth token.
member.param: Authentication token.
Authentication method (only OAuth 2.0 is supported at the moment).

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SendCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Executes a command on the SMTP server.
member.param: Command (e.g. "HELP").

remarks.p: Must be followed by a call to ReadResponse method.
Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ReadResponse
member.summary: Returns the response of the SMTP server to the command.

remarks.p: Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.
After a successful call to ReadResponse, the object will be in Processing state if the response Group is 3, in Reading state if the response Group is 1 or in Ready state in other cases.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this object.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Login(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the SMTP server.
member.param: User name.
Password.
member.remarks: This method tries to authenticate using the following methods, in this order of preference: CRAM-MD5, DIGEST-MD5, PLAIN, LOGIN, GSSAPI, NTLM. The NTLM and GSSAPI methods are only attempted if no other method is available - please use and specify NTLM or GSSAPI directly if you wish to use them.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.KeepAlive
member.summary: Sends the NOOP command to the server to keep the connection alive.

remarks.p: Represents SMTP NOOP command.
Call this if you do not want the connection to the server to time out.
Some servers ignore NOOP command.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SetSocketFactory(Rebex.Net.ISocketFactory)
member.summary: Sets the socket factory to be used to create communication sockets.
member.param: Socket factory.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.GetSupportedAuthenticationMethods
member.summary: Gets the list of supported authentication methods.
member.returns: The list of supported authentication methods.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends the message using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: Message to be sent.
The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string address.
The server port (e.g. 25).

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mail.MailMessage,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends the message using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: Message to be sent.
SMTP server hostname or IP address.
SMTP server port.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a mail message from the specified local file in MIME format and sends it using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: The path to the mail message file.
SMTP server hostname or IP address.
SMTP server port.

remarks.p: The file must be in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends a mail message constructed from the specified parameters using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: Message sender.
Comma-separated list of message recipients.
The subject of the message.
The text body of the message.
The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string address.
The server port (e.g. 25).

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ConnectAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Connect operation. Connects to the SMTP server.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string address.
An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: Welcome message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ConnectAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Connect operation. Connects to the SMTP server.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string address.
The server port (e.g. 25).
An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The welcome message returned by the server.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous Connect operation. Connects to the SMTP server with the specified security.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string IP address.
The server port (e.g. 25).
Connection security.

member.returns: The welcome message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ConnectAsync(System.String,Rebex.Net.SslMode,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Connect operation. Connects to the SMTP server with the specified security. Uses port 25 for no SSL, 587 for explicit SSL and 465 for implicit SSL.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string IP address.
Connection security.
An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The welcome message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.DisconnectAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Disconnect operation. Informs the server that the connection is about to close and terminates the connection.
member.remarks: Represents SMTP QUIT command.
member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The exit message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SecureAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Secure operation. Secures the connection with TLS/SSL using default parameters.
member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SendAsync(Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Send operation. Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
Message sender address (can be null or empty).
The list of recipients (can be null).
member.remarks:
If the sender address argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it is taken from the from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing.
If the sender address argument is empty string, it means null sender - same behavior as if "<>" would be specified.
If the recipients argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields.
The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending. Set the property to allow sending a mime message without a sender specified.
member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

Message sender address (can be null or empty string).
The list of recipients (can be null).

remarks.p: The stream must contain data in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

If the sender address argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it is taken from the from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing.
If the sender address argument is empty string, it means null sender - same behavior as if "<>" would be specified.
If the recipients argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields.
The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.
Set the property to allow sending a mail without a sender specified.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.LoginAsync(System.String,System.String,Rebex.Net.SmtpAuthentication,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Login operation. Authenticates the user to the SMTP server using the specified authentication method.
member.param: User name.
Password.
Authentication method.
An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.LoginAsync(System.String,Rebex.Net.SmtpAuthentication,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Login operation. Authenticates the user to the SMTP server using an OAuth token.
member.param: Authentication token.
Authentication method (only OAuth 2.0 is supported at the moment).
An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.LoginAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Login operation. Authenticates the user to the SMTP server.
member.param: User name.
Password.
member.remarks: This method tries to authenticate using the following methods, in this order of preference: CRAM-MD5, DIGEST-MD5, PLAIN, LOGIN, GSSAPI, NTLM. The NTLM and GSSAPI methods are only attempted if no other method is available - please use and specify NTLM or GSSAPI directly if you wish to use them.
member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SendCommandAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous SendCommand operation. Executes a command on the SMTP server.
member.param: Command (e.g. "HELP").

remarks.p: Must be followed by a call to ReadResponse method.
Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ReadResponseAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous ReadResponse operation. Returns the response of the SMTP server to the command.

remarks.p: Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.
After a successful call to ReadResponse, the object will be in Processing state if the response Group is 3, in Reading state if the response Group is 1 or in Ready state in other cases.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.KeepAliveAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous KeepAlive operation. Sends the NOOP command to the server to keep the connection alive.

remarks.p: Represents SMTP NOOP command.
Call this if you do not want the connection to the server to time out.
Some servers ignore NOOP command.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Encoding to use to encode and decode command parameters and server responses.
member.value: The Encoding to use to encode and decode command parameters and server responses. Default is .

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Settings
member.summary: Gets or sets Smtp object settings.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SupportedExtensions
member.summary: Gets the bit field specifying the extensions supported by the server.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.EnabledExtensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the bit field specifying the enabled extensions.
member.remarks: Enabled extensions will be used when appropriate. By default, all extensions are enabled.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.IsSecured
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the control connection is secured.
member.value: True if secure, false if not secure.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.TlsSocket
member.summary: Returns the TLS/SSL socket of secured control connection.
member.returns: The TLS/SSL socket of secured control connection, or null if the connection is not secured.
member.remarks: This property is intended for advanced users only. class does not expect the socket to be altered in any way.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time in milliseconds before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server.
The property affects both synchronous and asynchronous methods.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.AbortTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the abort operation times out.
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the abort operation times out. Default is 3000, which seems to be a reasonable value.
member.remarks: Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.LocalEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the local client .

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the remote server .

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is connected.

remarks.p: This property returns the latest known state of the session. When it returns false, the session was either never connected, or no longer connected. When it returns true, the session was connected at the time of the last I/O operation.
Note: There is no guarantee that the session is still connected even though returns true.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.IsAuthenticated
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the session is authenticated.
member.value: A value indicating whether the session is authenticated.
member.remarks: Use this to detect whether the session has been automatically preauthenticated prior to calling the Login method.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.DeliveryStatusNotificationConditions
member.summary: Gets or sets the bit field specifying the conditions under which the SMTP server should generate and send a delivery status notification (DSN) messages.
member.remarks: This is only used if the DSN extension is supported by the SMTP server and enabled - see and .

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.DeliveryStatusNotificationOriginalMessageMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating to the SMTP server whether it should attach the entire original message or headers only.
member.value: A value indicating how to include the full original message in the DSN.
member.remarks: This is only used if the DSN extension is supported by the SMTP server and enabled - see and .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified state, number of bytes transferred during the current transfer and progress since the last time the event was raised.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus
member.summary: Defines status codes for the class.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ConnectFailure
member.summary: The remote service point could not be contacted at the transport level.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ConnectionClosed
member.summary: The connection was prematurely closed.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.SocketError
member.summary: The error at transport level occurred.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure
member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the host name.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.Pending
member.summary: An operation is pending.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ProtocolError
member.summary: The response received from the server was complete but indicated a protocol-level error. For example, an SMTP protocol error such as '550 Unable to relay' would use this status.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ProxyNameResolutionFailure
member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the proxy host name.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ReceiveFailure
member.summary: A complete response was not received from the remote server due to an error at the transport level.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.OperationAborted
member.summary: The operation was aborted by a call to the method.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.UnclassifiableError
member.summary: An unclassifiable error occurred. This is the default value for .

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.SendFailure
member.summary: A complete request could not be sent to the remote server due to an error at the transport level.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ServerProtocolViolation
member.summary: The server response was not a valid SMTP response.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.Timeout
member.summary: No response was received during the time-out period for a request.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.AsyncError
member.summary: General exception in asynchronous call.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.OperationFailure
member.summary: The requested operation could not be completed.

member.value: The full unparsed response of the SMTP server.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of the SMTP response.
member.value: The description of the SMTP response.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Code
member.summary: Gets the SMTP response code.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Group
member.summary: Gets the group of the SMTP response code.
member.value: The group of the SMTP response code.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Success
member.summary: Returns true when last command was completed successfully.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Class
member.summary: Gets the class of enhanced SMTP status code, or -1 if not supported.
member.value: The class of enhanced SMTP status code.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Subject
member.summary: Gets the subject code of enhanced SMTP status code, or -1 if not supported.
member.value: The subject of enhanced SMTP status code.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Detail
member.summary: Gets the detail code of enhanced SMTP status code, or -1 if not supported.
member.value: The detail of enhanced SMTP status code.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SmtpRejectedRecipient
member.summary: Represents a recipient rejected by the SMTP server.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of using a specified address and response.
member.param: Address of the recipient.
Response that rejected the recipient.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpRejectedRecipient.Address
member.summary: Gets the address of the rejected recipient.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpRejectedRecipient.Response
member.summary: Gets the response that rejected the recipient.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpRejectedRecipient.Error
member.summary: Gets the exception thrown while attempting to deliver the message, if there was any.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SmtpConnectionState

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the object is connected.

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the object is connected.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpConnectionState.NativeErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the Win32 socket error code.
member.remarks: Returns 0 if no socket error code is available.
